info.title: Hyperledger Cactus Plugin - Connector Quorum
info.description: Can perform basic tasks on a Quorum ledger

ethAccount.description: The ethereum account (public key) that the credential  belongs to. Basically the username in the traditional terminology of authentication.
The ethereum account (public key) that the credential  belongs to. Basically the username in the traditional  terminology of authentication.

keychainEntryKey.description: The key to use when looking up the the keychain entry holding the secret pointed to by the  keychainEntryKey parameter.

keychainId.description: The keychain ID to use when looking up the the keychain plugin instance that will be used to retrieve the secret pointed to by the keychainEntryKey parameter.

ethAccount.description: The ethereum account (public key) that the credential belongs to. Basically the username in the traditional terminology of authentication.

secret.description: The HEX encoded private key of an eth account.

Web3SigningCredentialNone.description: Using this denotes that there is no signing required because the transaction is pre-signed.

bytecode.description: See https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/a/47556 regarding the maximum length of the bytecode

abi.description: The application binary interface of the solidity contract, optional parameter

timeoutMs.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait for a transaction receipt with thehash of the transaction(which indicates successful execution) beforegiving up and crashing.

contractName.description: The contract name for retrieve the contracts json on the keychain.

keychainId.description: The keychainId for retrieve the contracts json.

timeoutMs.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait for a transaction receipt with theaddress of the contract(which indicates successful deployment) beforegiving up and crashing.

contractJSON.description: For use when not using keychain, pass the contract in as this variable

constructorArgs.description: The list of arguments to pass in to the constructor of the contract being deployed.

timeoutMs.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait for a transaction receipt with theaddress of the contract(which indicates successful deployment) beforegiving up and crashing.

contractJSON.description: For use when not using keychain, pass the contract in as this variable

constructorArgs.description: The list of arguments to pass in to the constructor of the contract being deployed.

contractName.description: The contract name to find it in the keychain plugin

invocationType.description: Indicates wether it is a CALL or a SEND type of  invocation where only SEND ends up creating an actual transaction on the ledger.

methodName.description: The name of the contract method to invoke.

params.description: The list of arguments to pass in to the contract method being invoked.

timeoutMs.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait for a transaction receipt beforegiving up and crashing. Only has any effect if the invocation type is SEND

keychainId.description: The keychainId for retrieve the contracts json.

invocationType.description: Indicates wether it is a CALL or a SEND type of  invocation where only SEND ends up creating an actual transaction on the ledger.

methodName.description: The name of the contract method to invoke.

params.description: The list of arguments to pass in to the contract method being invoked.

timeoutMs.description: The amount of milliseconds to wait for a transaction receipt beforegiving up and crashing. Only has any effect if the invocation type is SEND

contractJSON.description: For use when not using keychain, pass the contract in as this variable

methodName.description: The name of the web3.eth method to invoke

params.description: The list of arguments to pass to web3.eth method specified in methodName

abi.description: The application binary interface of the solidity contract

invocationType.description: Contract invocation method to be performed (send, call, etc...)

invocationParams.description: The list of arguments for contract invocation method (send, call, etc...)

contractMethod.description: Method of deployed solidity contract to execute

contractMethodArgs.description: The list of arguments for deployed solidity contract method

post.summary: Deploys the bytecode of a Solidity contract.
Deploys the bytecode of a Solidity contract.
Executes a transaction on a quorum ledger
Invokes a contract on a besu ledger
Invokes a contract on a besu ledger
Low-level endpoint to invoke a method on deployed contract.
